119.author: by Charles M

120.heading: Buena Vista Home Entertainment.
120.title: The Lion King.
120.author: [No author]

publication info.publisher: Walt Disney Home Entertainment : Buena Vista Home Entertainment

notes: Originally released as a motion picture in 1994.

Summary (from OCLC): Simba begins life as an honored prince, son of the powerful King Mufasa. The cub's happy childhood turns tragic when his evil uncle Scar murders Mufasa and drives Simba away from the kingdom. In exile, the young lion befriends the comically bumbling pair of Pumbaa the warthog and Timon the meerkat and lives a carefree jungle life. As he approaches adulthood, however, he is visited by the spirit of his father, who instructs him to defeat the nefarious Scar and reclaim his rightful throne.
Library has book only intended to accompany a set of 2 DVDs.

121.heading: Buena Vista Home Video.
121.title: Crimebusters [videorecording]
121.author: The Walt Disney Company.

publication info.publisher: Walt Disney Home Video : Distributed by Buena Vista Home Video

notes: 1 videocassette (44 min.) : sd., col. ; 1/2 in.
(Disney's Chip 'n Dale Rescue Rangers)
VHS format.

Summary: Catteries not included: Chip and Dale are called in to solve the case of the catnapped kitten. The Rescue Rangers find it a tough nut to crack when nutty Professor Nimnul and his giant robot bulldogs weave a diabolical plot of cat-astrophic proportions.
Sumary: Piratsy under the seas: While hunting for sunken treasure, Rescue Ranger Dale finds himself in need of rescuing from a gang of sea pi-rats and Billy the Squid.

123.heading: Buena Vista Home Video.
123.title: The Rocketeer [videorecording]
123.author: Walt Disney Pictures in association with Silver Screen Partners IV ; produced by Lawrence Gordon, Charles Gordon, and Lloyd Levin ; screenplay by Danny Bilson & Paul de Meo ; directed by Joe Johnston.
notes: 1 videocassette (VHS) (109 min.) : sd. (stereo.), col. ; 1/2 in.
Based on the graphic novel The Rocketeer created by Dave Stevens.
Closed captioned for the hearing impaired.
Director of photography, Hiro Narita ; edited by Arthur Schmidt ; music composed by James Horner.
Cast: Bill Campbell, Alan Arkin, Jennifer Connelly.

Summary (from OCLC): In California, in 1938, test pilot Cliff Secord comes into possession of a top-secret jetpack which has been stolen from the government and is wanted by a Nazi spy who plans to use it to take over the world. Many harrowing adventures later, Cliff meets the villian face to face and uses the jetpack to rescue his fiancée from the Nazi's clutches.
